message: I'm not really aware of any, but hopefully we'll support SSL soon :)
I don't know if you're asking because you don't like disqus or what, but it appears like they have a HTTPS cert, could you just change the script src to the "http://" to "//" and it'll work?
Also DISQUS does work on HTTPS sites, you just get mixed content warnings in some browsers.
on django-cms.org it won't even load. also how is mixed content much better? and I love disqus, just a shame I can't use it.
Can anyone recommend a good commenting system (like Disqus) that works on HTTPS sites? Ideally it should be free, or at least reasonably priced.

is there any news from disqus on supporting HTTPS? I'm still not pissed off enough by this to write up my own solution, but having comments would be nicer than having a disqus logo that does nothing on our site :(
Looking for this aswell! Any updates from the Disqus team? A ETA? The oldest post saying: "it's coming soon" are from the summer 2010.
